DataElement.preferredDefinition: The category used to classify the frequency and duration of use related to the administration of acetaminophen, a drug that reduces pain and fever (but not inflammation).  It belongs to the family of drugs called analgesics.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the administration of acetaminophen, a drug that reduces pain and fever (but not inflammation).  It belongs to the family of drugs called analgesics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredDefinition: A drug that reduces pain and fever (but not inflammation).  It belongs to the family of drugs called analgesics.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A p-aminophenol derivative with analgesic and antipyretic activities. Although the exact mechanism through which acetaminophen exert its effects has yet to be fully determined, acetaminophen may inhibit the nitric oxide (NO) pathway mediated by a variety of neurotransmitter receptors including N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) and substance P, resulting in elevation of the pain threshold. The antipyretic activity may result from inhibition of prostaglandin synthesis and release in the central nervous system (CNS) and prostaglandin-mediated effects on the heat-regulating center in the anterior hypothalamus.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: This term is used informally to mean a class of things.

PermissibleValues.value: Once per week for at least one year
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Once per week for at least one year

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Once per week for at least one year
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Once per week for at least one year
From time to time, but not continually or always.

Concepts.definition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added "Sometimes" to represent the MSAS value domain.ghd.01.27.15

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The total quantity or number.: A dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of a product is delivered or administered over the time period of one week. This is also a unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to one week.

Concepts.definition: A dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of a product is delivered or administered over the time period of one week. This is also a unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to one week.

PermissibleValues.value: Less than or equal to 81 mg day
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Less Than or Equal To Amount Milligram per 24 Hours

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less Than or Equal To Amount Milligram per 24 Hours
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.: The total quantity or number.: A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to twenty four hours. Milligram per twenty four hours is also a dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of a product is administered per unit of time equal to twenty four hours.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.

A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to twenty four hours. Milligram per twenty four hours is also a dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of a product is administered per unit of time equal to twenty four hours.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Customary, usual, or at fixed intervals; conforming to a standard or pattern.: A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Customary, usual, or at fixed intervals; conforming to a standard or pattern.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
